displayManager

Class DisplayManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • displayManager.DisplayManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class DisplayManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener
    Display manager class is used to display the game board state

      • createDrawHexBoardPanel

        public void createDrawHexBoardPanel(GameBoard gameState,
                                    java.util.ArrayList<Unit> playerUnits,
                                    Unit currUnit,
                                    boolean turnScreenOn)
        Large method to draw the game board to its panel
        Parameters:
        gameState - current game state of the board
        playerUnits - player units
        currUnit - current unit of the player
        turnScreenOn - if screen should be turned on.

      • drawBoom

        private void drawBoom(java.util.ArrayList<Unit> units,
                      java.awt.geom.AffineTransform at,
                      java.awt.Graphics2D g3)
        Draw a boom graphic with on g3. If there is only one unit, draw a boom of that Units team's colour. If there is more than one unit, draw a multi-coloured boom.
        Parameters:
        units - A list of dead units that might be drawn as booms
        at - The transformation of the boom
        g3 - How the graphics are drawn.

      • endGame

        public void endGame(int winningPlayer,
                    java.util.ArrayList<Player> gamePlayers)
        Update the display when a player has won the game!
        Parameters:
        winningPlayer - the player who one, -1 if it was a draw.
        gamePlayers - All the players in the game

      • showUnitInfo

        public void showUnitInfo(java.util.ArrayList<Unit> units)
        Display the information associated with the units over top of the game board.
        Parameters:
        units - Units whose information needs to be shown

      • notifyPlayerTurn

        public void notifyPlayerTurn(java.awt.Color playerColour)
        Method to add a message and spawn a turn timer to tell the next player that their turn is starting in 5 seconds
        Parameters:
        playerColour - The colour of the player whos turn is next

      • endNotification

        public void endNotification()
